column1: Nuenen (Dutch pronunciation: [ˈnynə(n)]) is a town in the municipality of Nuenen
column2: Gerwen en Nederwetten in the Netherlands. From 1883 to 1885
column3: Vincent van Gogh lived and worked in Nuenen. In 1944
column4: the town was a battle scene during Operation Market Garden. The local dialect is called Peellands. In 2009

column1: Nuenen is listed in the 1792 Gazetteer of the Netherlands
column2: which lists it as "a village of Brabant

column1: During Operation Market Garden on September 20
column3: Nuenen was the scene of a battle involving the American 506th PIR of the 101st Airborne Division and the British 15th/19th The King's Royal Hussars of the 11th Armoured Division equipped with Cromwell tanks
column4: against the German 107th Panzer Brigade. The British lost two tanks
column5: and four American and three British soldiers were killed. The Germans suffered two fatalities.

column1: The fight is dramatised in episode 4 "Replacements" of the television series Band of Brothers.
The spoken language is Peellands (an East Brabantian dialect
column2: which is very similar to colloquial Dutch).

column1: In 1882 Van Gogh's father became a pastor in Nuenen and the family lived at the vicarage there.  After a stay in Drenthe for several months
column2: Van Gogh moved to live with his parents in December 1883 and stayed there until May 1885.Vincent van Gogh resided in Nuenen from 1883 to 1885. During that time he painted many character studies of peasants and weavers that culminated in The Potato Eaters
column3: and paintings of still life.  He also painted his father's church
column5: one such work being Congregation Leaving the Reformed Church in Nuenen (Het uitgaan van de hervormde kerk te Nuenen) depicting the church
column6: which is situated in a park area on the corner of Papenvoort Street and  Houtrijk Street in the north of Nuenen. This painting was stolen from the Van Gogh Museum in December 2002 and recovered in Italy in September 2016. There is a street named after it in the town
column8: college and bar. A statue of Van Gogh is located in the central park of the town.

column1: Theoretical computer scientist Edsger W. Dijkstra lived in Nuenen later in his life
column2: and died there in 2002. The following year
column3: the ACM (Association for Computing Machinery) PODC Influential Paper Award in distributed computing was renamed the Dijkstra Prize in his honour.

column1: Dutch cyclist Steven Kruijswijk was also born in Nuenen and had lived there in his youth.
